Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: The specified coordinates could not be matched to the road network.

Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: unableToLocate
Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: A specified location could not be associated with a roadway or pathway.

Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: rateLimited(rateLimitInterval:rateLimit:resetTime:)
Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: Too many requests have been made with the same access token within a certain period of time.

Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: unknown(response:underlying:code:message:)
Enums/DirectionsError.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: Unknown error case. Look at associated values for more details.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: unknown
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: There is not enough data to determine the level of congestion along the road segment.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: low
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: The road segment has little or no congestion. Traffic is flowing smoothly.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: moderate
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: The road segment has moderate, stop-and-go congestion. Traffic is flowing but speed is impeded.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: heavy
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: The road segment has heavy, bumper-to-bumper congestion. Traffic is barely moving.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.name: severe
Enums/CongestionLevel.html#/s:16MapboxDi.abstract: The road segment has severe congestion. Traffic may be completely stopped.

Enums/CongestionLevel.html.name: CongestionLevel
Enums/CongestionLevel.html.abstract: A CongestionLevel indicates the level of traffic congestion along a road segment relative to the normal flow of traffic along that segment. You can color-code a route line according to the congestion level along each segment of the route.

Enums/DirectionsError.html.name: DirectionsError
Enums/DirectionsError.html.abstract: An error that occurs when calculating directions.

Enums/DirectionsCodingError.html.name: DirectionsCodingError
Enums/DirectionsCodingError.html.abstract: An error that occurs when encoding or decoding a type defined by the MapboxDirections framework.

Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html.name: RouteShapeFormat
Enums/RouteShapeFormat.html.abstract: A RouteShapeFormat indicates the format of a route or match shape in the raw HTTP response.

Enums/RouteShapeResolution.html.name: RouteShapeResolution
Enums/RouteShapeResolution.html.abstract: A RouteShapeResolution indicates the level of detail in a route’s shape, or whether the shape is present at all.

Enums/MeasurementSystem.html.name: MeasurementSystem
Enums/MeasurementSystem.html.abstract: A system of units of measuring distances and other quantities.

Enums/DrivingSide.html.name: DrivingSide
Enums/DrivingSide.html.abstract: A DrivingSide indicates which side of the road cars and traffic flow.

Enums/IsochroneError.html.name: IsochroneError
Enums/IsochroneError.html.abstract: An error that occurs when calculating isochrone contours.

Other%20Enums.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.name: Weight
Other%20Enums.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.abstract: A Weight enum represents the weight given to a specific Match by the Directions API. The default metric is a compound index called “routability”, which is duration-based with additional penalties for less desirable maneuvers.

Enums/MapboxStreetsRoadClass.html.name: MapboxStreetsRoadClass
Enums/MapboxStreetsRoadClass.html.abstract: A road classification according to the Mapbox Streets source , version 8.

Enums/TransportType.html.name: TransportType
Enums/TransportType.html.abstract: A TransportType specifies the mode of transportation used for part of a route.

Enums/ManeuverType.html.name: ManeuverType
Enums/ManeuverType.html.abstract: A ManeuverType specifies the type of maneuver required to complete the route step. You can pair a maneuver type with a ManeuverDirection to choose an appropriate visual or voice prompt to present the user.

Enums/ManeuverDirection.html.name: ManeuverDirection
Enums/ManeuverDirection.html.abstract: A ManeuverDirection clarifies a ManeuverType with directional information. The exact meaning of the maneuver direction for a given step depends on the step’s maneuver type; see the ManeuverType documentation for details.

Other%20Global%20Variables.html#/s:16Map.name: MBDirectionsErrorDomain
Other%20Global%20Variables.html#/s:16Map.abstract: Indicates that an error occurred in MapboxDirections.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.name: init(distanceAlongStep:primary:secondary:tertiary:quaternary:drivingSide:)
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.abstract: Initializes a visual instruction banner with the given instructions.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.name: distanceAlongStep
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.abstract: The distance at which the visual instruction should be shown, measured in meters from the beginning of the step.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.name: primaryInstruction
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.abstract: The most important information to convey to the user about the RouteStep.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.name: tertiaryInstruction
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.abstract: A visual instruction that is presented simultaneously to provide information about an additional maneuver that occurs in rapid succession.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.name: quaternaryInstruction
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.abstract: A visual instruction that is presented to provide information about the incoming junction.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.name: drivingSide
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html#/s:.abstract: Which side of a bidirectional road the driver should drive on, also known as the rule of the road.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.name: Format
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.abstract: File formats of visual instruction component images.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.name: init(imageBaseURL:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.abstract: Initializes an image representation bearing the image at the given base URL.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.name: imageBaseURL
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.abstract: The URL whose path is the prefix of all the possible URLs returned by imageURL(scale:format:).

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.name: imageURL(scale:format:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.abstract: Returns a remote URL to the image file that represents the component.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.name: init(text:abbreviation:abbreviationPriority:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.abstract: Initializes a text representation bearing the given abbreviatable text.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.name: text
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.abstract: The plain text representation of this component.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.name: abbreviationPriority
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.abstract: The priority for which the component should be abbreviated.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: delimiter(text:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: The component separates two other destination components.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: text(text:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: The component bears the name of a place or street.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: image(image:alternativeText:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: The component is an image, such as a route marker, with a fallback text representation.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: guidanceView(image:alternativeText:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: The component is an image of a zoomed junction, with a fallback text representation.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: exit(text:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: The component contains the localized word for “Exit”.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: lane(indications:isUsable:preferredDirection:)
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: A component that represents a turn lane or through lane at the approach to an intersection.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.name: TextRepresentation
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Text.abstract: A textual representation of a visual instruction component.

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.name: ImageRepresentation
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component/Imag.abstract: An image representation of a visual instruction component.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: init(text:maneuverType:maneuverDirection:components:degrees:)
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: Initializes a new visual instruction banner object that displays the given information.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: text
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A plain text representation of the instruction.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: maneuverType
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: The type of maneuver required for beginning the step described by the visual instruction.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: maneuverDirection
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: Additional directional information to clarify the maneuver type.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: finalHeading
Classes/VisualInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: The heading at which the user exits a roundabout (traffic circle or rotary).

Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.name: Component
Classes/VisualInstruction/Component.html.abstract: A unit of information displayed to the user as part of a VisualInstruction.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: distanceAlongStep
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A distance along the associated RouteStep at which to read the instruction aloud.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: text
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A plain-text representation of the speech-optimized instruction.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.name: ssmlText
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A formatted representation of the speech-optimized instruction.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: Session
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A tuple type representing the isochrone session that was generated from the request.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: IsochroneCompletionHandler
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A closure (block) to be called when a isochrone request is complete.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: credentials
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The Authorization & Authentication credentials that are used for this service.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: init(credentials:urlSession:processingQueue:)
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Creates a new instance of Isochrones object.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: calculate(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Begins asynchronously calculating isochrone contours using the given options and delivers the results to a closure.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: url(forCalculating:)
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The GET HTTP URL used to fetch the contours from the API.

Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: urlRequest(forCalculating:)
Classes/Isochrones.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The HTTP request used to fetch the contours from the API.

Classes/IsochroneOptions/Contours.html#/.name: byExpectedTravelTimes(_:)
Classes/IsochroneOptions/Contours.html#/.abstract: The desired travel times to use for each isochrone contour.

Classes/IsochroneOptions/Contours.html#/.name: byDistances(_:)
Classes/IsochroneOptions/Contours.html#/.abstract: The distances to use for each isochrone contour.

Classes/IsochroneOptions/ContourFormat.h.name: lineString
Classes/IsochroneOptions/ContourFormat.h.abstract: Requested contour will be presented as GeoJSON LineString.

Classes/IsochroneOptions/ContourFormat.h.name: polygon
Classes/IsochroneOptions/ContourFormat.h.abstract: Requested contour will be presented as GeoJSON Polygon.

Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: profileIdentifier
Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: A string specifying the primary mode of transportation for the contours.

Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: centerCoordinate
Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: A coordinate around which to center the isochrone lines.

Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: denoisingFactor
Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: Removes contours which are denoisingFactor times smaller than the biggest one.

Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: urlQueryItems
Classes/IsochroneOptions.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: An array of URL query items (parameters) to include in an HTTP request.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: shape
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The roads or paths taken as a contiguous polyline.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: legs
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The legs that are traversed in order.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: expectedTravelTime
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The route’s expected travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: typicalTravelTime
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The route’s typical travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: speechLocale
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The locale to use for spoken instructions.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: fetchStartDate
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The time immediately before a Directions object fetched this result.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.name: responseEndDate
Classes/DirectionsResult.html#/s:16Mapbo.abstract: The time immediately before a Directions object received the last byte of this result.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: init(waypoints:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: Initializes an options object for routes between the given waypoints and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: waypoints
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: An array of Waypoint objects representing locations that the route should visit in chronological order.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: profileIdentifier
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A string specifying the primary mode of transportation for the routes.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: includesSteps
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether RouteStep objects should be included in the response.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: shapeFormat
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: Format of the data from which the shapes of the returned route and its steps are derived.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: routeShapeResolution
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: Resolution of the shape of the returned route.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: attributeOptions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: AttributeOptions for the route. Any combination of AttributeOptions can be specified.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: locale
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: The locale in which the route’s instructions are written.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: includesSpokenInstructions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether each route step includes an array of SpokenInstructions.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: distanceMeasurementSystem
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: The measurement system used in spoken instructions included in route steps.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: includesVisualInstructions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: If true, each RouteStep will contain the property visualInstructionsAlongStep.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: fetchStartDate
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: The time immediately before a Directions object fetched this result.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.name: urlQueryItems
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html#/s:16Mapb.abstract: An array of URL query items (parameters) to include in an HTTP request.

Classes/DirectionsOptions.html.name: DirectionsOptions
Classes/DirectionsOptions.html.abstract: Options for calculating results from the Mapbox Directions service.

Classes/DirectionsResult.html.name: DirectionsResult
Classes/DirectionsResult.html.abstract: A DirectionsResult represents a result returned from either the Mapbox Directions service.

Classes/IsochroneOptions.html.name: IsochroneOptions
Classes/IsochroneOptions.html.abstract: Options for calculating contours from the Mapbox Isochrone service.

Classes/Isochrones.html.name: Isochrones
Classes/Isochrones.html.abstract: Computes areas that are reachable within a specified amount of time or distance from a location, and returns the reachable regions as contours of polygons or lines that you can display on a map.

Classes/SpokenInstruction.html.name: SpokenInstruction
Classes/SpokenInstruction.html.abstract: An instruction about an upcoming RouteStep’s maneuver, optimized for speech synthesis.

Classes/VisualInstruction.html.name: VisualInstruction
Classes/VisualInstruction.html.abstract: The contents of a banner that should be displayed as added visual guidance for a route. The banner instructions are children of the steps during which they should be displayed, but they refer to the maneuver in the following step.

Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html.name: VisualInstructionBanner
Classes/VisualInstructionBanner.html.abstract: A visual instruction banner contains all the information necessary for creating a visual cue about a given RouteStep.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Initializes a step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: shape
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The path of the route step from the location of the maneuver to the location of the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: transportType
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The mode of transportation used for the step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: maneuverLocation
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The location of the maneuver at the beginning of this step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: maneuverType
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The type of maneuver required for beginning this step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: maneuverDirection
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Additional directional information to clarify the maneuver type.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: instructions
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: A string with instructions explaining how to perform the step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: initialHeading
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The user’s heading immediately before performing the maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: finalHeading
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The user’s heading immediately after performing the maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: drivingSide
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Indicates what side of a bidirectional road the driver must be driving on. Also referred to as the rule of the road.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: exitIndex
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The number of exits from the previous maneuver up to and including this step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: exitCodes
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Any exit numbers assigned to the highway exit at the maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: exitNames
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The names of the roundabout exit.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: phoneticExitNames
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: A phonetic or phonemic transcription indicating how to pronounce the names in the exitNames property.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: distance
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The step’s distance, measured in meters.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: expectedTravelTime
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The step’s expected travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: typicalTravelTime
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The step’s typical travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: names
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The names of the road or path leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: phoneticNames
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: A phonetic or phonemic transcription indicating how to pronounce the names in the names property.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: codes
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Any route reference codes assigned to the road or path leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: destinationCodes
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Any route reference codes that appear on guide signage for the road leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: destinations
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Destinations, such as control cities, that appear on guide signage for the road leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: intersections
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: An array of intersections along the step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: administrativeAreaContainerByIntersection
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Each intersection’s administrative region index.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: segmentIndicesByIntersection
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Segments indices for each Intersection along the step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: speedLimitSignStandard
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The sign design standard used for speed limit signs along the step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: speedLimitUnit
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: The unit of speed limits on speed limit signs along the step.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: instructionsSpokenAlongStep
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Instructions about the next step’s maneuver, optimized for speech synthesis.

Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.name: instructionsDisplayedAlongStep
Classes/RouteStep.html#/s:16MapboxDirect.abstract: Instructions about the next step’s maneuver, optimized for display in real time.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.name: segmentDistances
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.abstract: An array containing the distance (measured in meters) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.name: expectedSegmentTravelTimes
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.abstract: An array containing the expected travel time (measured in seconds) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.name: segmentSpeeds
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.abstract: An array containing the expected average speed (measured in meters per second) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.name: segmentCongestionLevels
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.abstract: An array containing the traffic congestion level along each road segment in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.name: segmentNumericCongestionLevels
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.abstract: An array containing the traffic congestion level along each road segment in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.name: segmentMaximumSpeedLimits
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html#/s:16Ma.abstract: An array containing the maximum speed limit along each road segment along the route leg’s shape.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: init(steps:name:distance:expectedTravelTime:typicalTravelTime:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: Initializes a route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: init(from:)
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: Creates a route leg from a decoder.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: source
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The starting point of the route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: destination
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The endpoint of the route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: steps
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array of one or more RouteStep objects representing the steps for traversing this leg of the route.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentRangesByStep
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The ranges of each step’s segments within the overall leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentDistances
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the distance (measured in meters) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: expectedSegmentTravelTimes
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the expected travel time (measured in seconds) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentSpeeds
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the expected average speed (measured in meters per second) between each coordinate in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentCongestionLevels
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the traffic congestion level along each road segment in the route leg geometry.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentNumericCongestionLevels
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the traffic congestion level along each road segment in the route leg geometry in numeric form.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: segmentMaximumSpeedLimits
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: An array containing the maximum speed limit along each road segment along the route leg’s shape.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: regionCode(atStepIndex:intersectionIndex:)
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: Returns the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code for the administrative region through which the given intersection passes. The intersection is identified by its step index and intersection index.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: name
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: A name that describes the route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: distance
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The route leg’s distance, measured in meters.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: expectedTravelTime
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The route leg’s expected travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: administrativeRegions
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The administrative regions through which the leg passes.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: incidents
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: Contains Incidents data which occur during current RouteLeg.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: typicalTravelTime
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The route leg’s typical travel time, measured in seconds.

Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: profileIdentifier
Classes/RouteLeg.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The primary mode of transportation for the route leg.

Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html.name: Attributes
Classes/RouteLeg/Attributes.html.abstract: A collection of per-segment attributes along a route leg.

Classes/Route.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.name: refreshLegAttributes(from:)
Classes/Route.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.abstract: Merges the attributes of the given route’s legs into the receiver’s legs.

Classes/Route.html.name: Route
Classes/Route.html.abstract: A Route object defines a single route that the user can follow to visit a series of waypoints in order. The route object includes information about the route, such as its distance and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to calculate the route, the route object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

Classes/RouteLeg.html.name: RouteLeg
Classes/RouteLeg.html.abstract: A RouteLeg object defines a single leg of a route between two waypoints. If the overall route has only two waypoints, it has a single RouteLeg object that covers the entire route. The route leg object includes information about the leg, such as its name, distance, and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to calculate the route, the route leg object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

Classes/RouteStep.html.name: RouteStep
Classes/RouteStep.html.abstract: A RouteStep object represents a single distinct maneuver along a route and the approach to the next maneuver. The route step object corresponds to a single instruction the user must follow to complete a portion of the route. For example, a step might require the user to turn then follow a road.

Classes/Match.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.name: weight
Classes/Match.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.abstract: A Weight enum, which represents the weight given to a specific Match.

Classes/Match.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.name: confidence
Classes/Match.html#/s:16MapboxDirections.abstract: A number between 0 and 1 that indicates the Map Matching API’s confidence that the match is accurate. A higher confidence means the match is more likely to be accurate.

Classes/Tracepoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: countOfAlternatives
Classes/Tracepoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Number of probable alternative matchings for this tracepoint. A value of zero indicates that this point was matched unambiguously.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: init(locations:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: Initializes a match options object for matching locations against the road network.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: init(coordinates:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: Initializes a match options object for matching geographic coordinates against the road network.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: resamplesTraces
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: If true, the input locations are re-sampled for improved map matching results. The default is false.

Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: waypointIndices
Classes/MatchOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: An index set containing indices of two or more items in coordinates. These will be represented by Waypoints in the resulting Match objects.

Classes/MatchOptions.html.name: MatchOptions
Classes/MatchOptions.html.abstract: A MatchOptions object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Map Matching API.

Classes/Tracepoint.html.name: Tracepoint
Classes/Tracepoint.html.abstract: A Tracepoint represents a location matched to the road network.

Classes/Match.html.name: Match
Classes/Match.html.abstract: A Match object defines a single route that was created from a series of points that were matched against a road network.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: init(coordinate:coordinateAccuracy:name:)
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: Initializes a new waypoint object with the given geographic coordinate and an optional accuracy and name.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/init(location:hea.name: init(location:heading:name:)
Classes/Waypoint.html#/init(location:hea.abstract: Initializes a new waypoint object with the given CLLocation object and an optional heading value and name.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: init(location:heading:name:)
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: Initializes a new waypoint object with the given CLLocation object and an optional CLHeading object and name.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: coordinateAccuracy
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The radius of uncertainty for the waypoint, measured in meters.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: targetCoordinate
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The geographic coordinate of the waypoint’s target.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: allowsSnappingToClosedRoad
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the waypoint may be snapped to a closed road in the resulting RouteResponse.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: snappedDistance
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The straight-line distance from the coordinate specified in the query to the location it was snapped to in the resulting RouteResponse.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: heading
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The direction from which a route must approach this waypoint in order to be considered viable.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: headingAccuracy
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: The maximum amount, in degrees, by which a route’s approach to a waypoint may differ from heading in either direction in order to be considered viable.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: allowsArrivingOnOppositeSide
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether arriving on opposite side is allowed.

Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.name: separatesLegs
Classes/Waypoint.html#/s:16MapboxDirecti.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the waypoint is significant enough to appear in the resulting routes as a waypoint separating two legs, along with corresponding guidance instructions.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: init(waypoints:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: Initializes a route options object for routes between the given waypoints and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: init(locations:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: Initializes a route options object for routes between the given locations and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: init(coordinates:profileIdentifier:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: Initializes a route options object for routes between the given geographic coordinates and an optional profile identifier.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: init(matchOptions:)
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: Initializes an equivalent route options object from a match options object. Desirable for building a navigation experience from map matching.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: allowsUTurnAtWaypoint
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether a returned route may require a point U-turn at an intermediate waypoint.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: roadClassesToAvoid
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: The route classes that the calculated routes will avoid.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: roadClassesToAllow
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: The route classes that the calculated routes will allow.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: alleyPriority
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: The number that influences whether the route should prefer or avoid alleys or narrow service roads between buildings.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: walkwayPriority
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: The number that influences whether the route should prefer or avoid roads or paths that are set aside for pedestrian-only use (walkways or footpaths).

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: speed
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: The expected uniform travel speed measured in meters per second.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: includesAlternativeRoutes
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether alternative routes should be included in the response.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: includesExitRoundaboutManeuver
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the route includes a ManeuverType.exitRoundabout or ManeuverType.exitRotary step when traversing a roundabout or rotary, respectively.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: refreshingEnabled
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether Directions can refresh time-dependent properties of the RouteLegs of the resulting Routes.

Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.name: initialManeuverAvoidanceRadius
Classes/RouteOptions.html#/s:16MapboxDir.abstract: A radius around the starting point in which the API will avoid returning any significant maneuvers.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: Session
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A tuple type representing the direction session that was generated from the request.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: RouteCompletionHandler
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A closure (block) to be called when a directions request is complete.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: MatchCompletionHandler
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A closure (block) to be called when a map matching request is complete.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: RouteRefreshCompletionHandler
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: A closure (block) to be called when a directions refresh request is complete.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: credentials
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The Authorization & Authentication credentials that are used for this service.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: init(credentials:urlSession:processingQueue:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Creates a new instance of Directions object.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: calculate(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Begins asynchronously calculating routes using the given options and delivers the results to a closure.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: calculate(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Begins asynchronously calculating matches using the given options and delivers the results to a closure.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: calculateRoutes(matching:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Begins asynchronously calculating routes that match the given options and delivers the results to a closure.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: refreshRoute(responseIdentifier:routeIndex:fromLegAtIndex:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Begins asynchronously refreshing the route with the given identifier, optionally starting from an arbitrary leg along the route.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: url(forCalculating:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The GET HTTP URL used to fetch the routes from the API.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: url(forCalculating:httpMethod:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The HTTP URL used to fetch the routes from the API using the specified HTTP method.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: urlRequest(forCalculating:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The HTTP request used to fetch the routes from the API.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: availableVersionsURL
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: The URL to a list of available versions.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: tilesURL(for:version:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Returns the URL to generate and download a tile pack from the Route Tiles API.

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: fetchAvailableOfflineVersions(completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Fetches the available offline routing tile versions and returns them in descending chronological order. The most recent version should typically be passed into downloadTiles(in:version:completionHandler:).

Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.name: downloadTiles(in:version:completionHandler:)
Classes/Directions.html#/s:16MapboxDirec.abstract: Downloads offline routing tiles of the given version within the given coordinate bounds using the shared URLSession. The tiles are written to disk at the location passed into the completionHandler.

Classes/Directions.html.name: Directions
Classes/Directions.html.abstract: A Directions object provides you with optimal directions between different locations, or waypoints. The directions object passes your request to the Mapbox Directions API and returns the requested information to a closure (block) that you provide. A directions object can handle multiple simultaneous requests. A RouteOptions object specifies criteria for the results, such as intermediate waypoints, a mode of transportation, or the level of detail to be returned.

Classes/RouteOptions.html.name: RouteOptions
Classes/RouteOptions.html.abstract: A RouteOptions object is a structure that specifies the criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Directions API.

Classes/Waypoint.html.name: Waypoint
Classes/Waypoint.html.abstract: A Waypoint object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint. You create a RouteOptions object using waypoint objects and also receive waypoint objects in the completion handler of the Directions.calculate(_:completionHandler:) method.

Other%20Global%20Variables.html.name: Other Global Variables
Other%20Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Other%20Typealiases.html.name: Other Type Aliases
Other%20Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
